meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a duck.
meanings.sent1: The pond was full of duckish creatures swimming gracefully.
meanings.sent2: Her yellow raincoat had a duckish design on it.
meanings.sent3: The duckish hat made him look quite quacky!
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky had a duckish shape, like a flock of ducks flying south.
meanings.sent5: The duckish sound of the quacking echoed across the calm lake.

meanings.definition: Acting or behaving like a duck.
meanings.sent1: The little girl waddled in a duckish manner, pretending to be a duck.
meanings.sent2: His duckish walk made everyone laugh at the park.
meanings.sent3: The duckish dance moves at the party were quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: She had a duckish way of avoiding the rain, always finding shelter near water.
meanings.sent5: The duckish behavior of the toddler brought smiles to everyone around.
